intro: Verbascum mesopotamicum, commonly known as the Mesopotamian mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Verbascum mesopotamicum is a perennial herb that is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and historical medicinal uses.
